page.title: 20LAPLEY.
page.content: Lap@ley is a small village with some fifty seven dwellings.Twenty five or so having been built in the last thirty years.At the moment two more are being built. There is a Parish Church which was built during the years 1063 - 1414 by the Abbots of St.Remigius who were lords of the manor upto the time of the dissolution of the Alien Priories by Henry V ,in the year 1414. At the moment there are two families farming in the village.Dairy and arable farming approx 2000 acres. We also have a "Pub"- the Vaughan Arms which has recently been refurbished and extended.The name no doubt having been derived from an old Lapley familyÂ£The Vaughans' who owned Lapley Estates till approx 1920.
